item.title: Fortnite: How to Get the Fishpool Skin
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Get Fishpool in Fortnite
  • Fishpool Set Items in Fortnite

Fortnite and Marvel have joined forces on more than one occasion, and now it has happened yet again with the release of the latest Fortnite x Deadpool crossover skin: Fishpool. Disney first teased Fishpool during the D23 livestream, and players have been waiting for its release since then.

Fishpool is finally available in Fortnite , and this guide will tell players everything they need to know about getting this skin in-game. Keep reading to learn more about its release.

How to Get Fishpool in Fortnite

Disney teased the Fishpool skin during the D23 livestream with a drawing but an official skin design hadn't been shown until the skin actually became available in the Item Shop. Additionally, the skin's price was also unknown until it was actually released.

The Fishpool skin is available for 1,500 V-Bucks in the Fortnite Item Shop, and it'll be available until November 4, 2024, at 8 PM ET. If players aren't able to purchase it from their preferred platform, they can get the Fishpool skin from the official Item Shop website.

Fishpool Set Items in Fortnite

There isn't a Fishpool bundle in Fortnite ; there is only a skin and back bling in-game, and they're both part of the Deadpool set

If gamers purchase the Fishpool skin in Fortnite for 1,500 V-Bucks, they'll immediately unlock its back bling, the Kelp-Corn Bucket . It is unknown if the future will bring additional Fishpool cosmetics, but for now, this is all players will be able to acquire when they buy Fishpool.

item.title: Black Ops 6 Zombies: How to Complete the Secret Spore Quest for a Free Perk
item.description:
Black Ops 6 continues its great streak of having incredible secrets that will see players rewarded with loot and extra Perk-a-Colas. Terminus has yet another secret, this time in the form of island care, as players will need to take out a few gaseous spores and deal with a bug infestation to be rewarded with a free Perk-a-Cola guaranteed.

Not only will players receive a Perk-a-Cola upon the completion of this short and sweet quest in Black Ops 6 Zombies , but they will also obtain a Refined Aetherium Crystal to Pack-a-Punch their weapon to Tier 2. If done correctly, this means that players can have a free Perk and a Tier 2 Pack-a-Punch weapon at round 6 at the earliest!

Take a Boat Out to Sea and Find a Spore-Infested Island

To start, it’s best that players have a comfortable weapon for long-range shooting, as they are going to be dealing with pesky Parasites and popping some nasty zits located around a rock. Players will need to grab themselves a boat and head out to sea, orbiting the main Terminus Island as they look for a random rock that’s covered in spores.

The image above is what players are looking for, but each player will have a random rock where spores have begun to sprout, so it will not be the same every game. All players need to do is shoot out every spore located around the rock, but doing so will cause a Parasite to spawn. The Parasites can be ignored or killed, but once every spore has been destroyed, a growl will occur, signaling that players have completed the step.

After destroying the first spore-infested rock, players then need to progress to another round , where they will then need to take a boat and look for the infestation. Upon finding it, do the same extermination protocol and destroy all of the spores. Then, players need to do it for a third and final time on a new round, meaning that they must destroy three spore islands in total .

Return to the Sea Caves Where Speed Cola Resides

After players have successfully located and destroyed three islands filled with spores, it’s time to head back to the Sea Caves, located where Speed Cola is. Inside, players will see a spore on the ground, and upon shooting it, they can see that the Sea Caves are overrun with spores. Destroying all of them will spawn Parasites, but make short work of them and shoot the final spore. In doing so, an abundance of loot will drop, and players will also have a guaranteed Perk-a-Cola Power-Up, which will be a randomized perk.

This is a great secret to get done every game and in the early rounds for a good head start, especially since it’s very likely that players can get a Refined Aetherium Crystal, which when picked up, will instantly Pack-a-Punch the equipped weapon to Tier 2.

item.title: Black Ops 6 Zombies: How to Breathe Underwater Longer on Terminus
item.description:
Black Ops 6 ’s Terminus map houses a plethora of secrets, and many are still to be discovered as players dive into the cold and dangerous waters surrounding this prison island. With so many chests to uncover when diving into the depths, some Black Ops 6 players might wish they had a diving suit to keep a steady supply of oxygen to avoid the risk of drowning.

Luckily for them, players can get their hands on that very thing, and it’s extremely easy to do. In every game, players can grab an oxygen tank in a secret spot that grants them the ability to breathe underwater in Terminus for over a minute straight, which makes exploring under the sea so much easier.

How to Get the Oxygen Tank on Terminus

To start this secret easter egg, players are going to need to bring along a piece of lethal equipment that they can throw underwater. For efficiency, it’s best to just bring the regular Frag. Now, it’s time to head down to the Bio Lab and make sure that all the AMP Generators are online so that power is on.

Players can jump into the water in the Bio Lab and dive down, swimming to the area where they first activated the Pack-a-Punch. To the left of this area, there will be a rock with a slight glow to it. Players need to throw a grenade at this rock to blow it up and reveal an oxygen canister in its place. If players interact with the oxygen canister, they will refill their oxygen meter to stay underwater for longer. With the oxygen tank equipped, players can now passively breathe underwater for around 80 seconds without having to resurface for air.

While it’s great to swim underwater for longer durations, the tentacle can still spawn a gas attack that will easily kill players if they are not on the surface. The tentacle will consistently spawn when players are in the water, and will not go away until they progress to a new round.

item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley Reveals New Expansion Pass
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • The Disney Dreamlight Valley DLC, Storybook Vale, is set to release in two parts with a new land and characters for players to explore.
  • Players can team up with Merida and Flynn Rider to save new biomes from Hades with a new item, the Royal Rod.

Gameloft has detailed what players can expect from the Disney Dreamlight Valley paid DLC, The Storybook Vale, when it releases later in 2024. Since its release in September 2022, Disney Dreamlight Valley has come a long way. The life-sim has seen a host of paid and free updates added to keep players exploring the vast world of Disney characters.

The Trick or Treat event in Disney Dreamlight Valley runs until October 31, where players create as much candy as possible before handing it out to residents in return for themed goodies. As the event enters its last few days, gamers are wondering what’s next. To this end, Gameloft has announced what players can expect from the Disney life-sim.

The Disney Dreamlight Valley Storybook Vale DLC will be released in two parts, with the first set for November 20. The paid expansion pass will be available for $29.99 and introduces players to the Vale, a new land containing three new biomes, the Bind, Everafter, and Mythopia. Following on from the conclusion of A Rift in Time story arc, gamers are tasked with teaming up with Merida from Pixar’s Brave and Flynn Rider from Disney’s Tangled to save the latest Biomes from Hades with a new item, the Royal Rod.

Dreamlight Valley Storybook Vale Expansion

  • Release Date:
    • Part One - November 20, 2024
    • Part Two - Summer 2025

  • Price:
    • $29.99 Standard Edition
    • $49.99 Magical Edition

  • New Biomes
    • The Bind
    • Everafter
    • Mythopia

  • New Characters:
    • Merida (Brave)
    • Flynn Rider (Tangled)
    • Hades (Hercules)

The second part of the expansion pass, titled The Unwritten Realms, is set to be released in 2025. Anyone looking to buy and play the Disney Dreamlight Valley: Storybook Vale expansion before December will also receive additional bonuses in the form of dark academia-themed clothing. Gameloft is also offering The Storybook Vale: Magical Edition for $49.99, which adds in new ensemble outfits, the Autumn Manor House, a Hercules-themed house with baby Pegasus, and 10,000 Moonstones.

The paid DLC expansion isn’t the only thing that players will be able to access. Free content for Disney Dreamlight Valley is coming on December 4. The "Sew Delightful" update sees Sally from Tim Burton’s The Nightmare Before Christmas join as the latest Dreamlight Valley Villager, with gamers being able to undertake specific quests with her to unlock themed decorations.

Disney Dreamlight Valley appears to be going from strength to strength as the 2024-2025 roadmap takes shape. The free December 4 update will also include The Floating Islands, a new feature teased in the Dreamlight Valley August update that gives players more design space and storage. The next free updates are set to drop throughout 2025, with Gameloft teasing the addition of Jasmine and Aladdin, quests based on Alice in Wonderland , and more Peter Pan content for players to enjoy.

item.title: Asmongold Plans on Streaming Dragon Age: The Veilguard
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Asmongold plans to stream Dragon Age: The Veilguard.
  • The game's global release is imminent, and Asmongold may play it sooner rather than later.
  • Despite initial skepticism, Asmongold still intends to try out the highly anticipated RPG.

Popular streamer Asmongold has revealed his plans to stream Dragon Age: The Veilguard now that his Twitch ban has ended. Considering that the game's global release is only days away, Asmongold may be trying out Dragon Age: The Veilguard on his Twitch channel sooner rather than later.

Earlier in October, Zack "Asmongold" Hoyt was banned from Twitch for making offensive comments about Palestinians. Though he later issued an apology, Asmongold stepped away from OTK and Starforge Systems, two companies that he co-owns, and took a break from streaming altogether. There was speculation that his ban would last for 14 days. This time period turned out to be true as Asmongold’s Twitch channel went back online on October 29, and he held a lengthy livestream on the same day. The content creator now plans on streaming one of the most anticipated games of the year.

On October 28, one of Asmongold’s Twitter followers asked him if he would stream Dragon Age: The Veilguard after his return to Twitch. “Absolutely,” responded the streamer. After 10 years of waiting, the hype for Dragon Age: The Veilguard is immense among players. The game’s reviews ahead of its release were very positive overall. However, Asmongold shared his skepticism of the game’s quality in a previous YouTube video. Despite this, he still seems willing to play the RPG on his Twitch channel.

Asmongold Plans on Streaming Dragon Age: The Veilguard

During his time away from streaming, Asmongold decided to clean his house, which was well-known to be quite messy. His return to Twitch and streaming may take up more of his time, though, considering that Dragon Age: The Veilguard will take around 100 hours to complete, according to developer BioWare. The game is set for release on October 31, so fans might see Asmongold play it in the upcoming days. Aside from apologizing for his actions, the streamer also assured his community that he planned on becoming a better version of himself and creating more positive content.

Like Asmongold, many gaming content creators have been looking forward to streaming Dragon Age: The Veilguard . To experience the franchise's next adventure, players should consider that Dragon Age: The Veilguard is a large game and will demand a lot of storage. There has been some criticism that the game is too "woke" for having pansexual companions. Asmongold has long proclaimed himself as part of the "anti-woke" movement, but bearing in mind his intentions to produce less negative content, perhaps he'll take a more positive approach to the game.
